title: Rear Sprocket Carrier and Cush Drive - Removal

body.body: Rear Sprocket Carrier and Cush Drive - Removal
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Caution - Wheels - Do not rest on brake disc
Do not allow the wheel to rest on the brake disc, as this may damage the disc. Support the wheel on wooden blocks, equally spaced around the rim, such that the brake disc is raised above the ground.
Place the wheel on wooden blocks with the drive chain sprocket uppermost.
Note the position and orientation of the spacer for installation.
Gently lever the drive chain sprocket and flange from the wheel hub. Collect the spacer.
